dict.string: Block Calendar and Agenda: View, search, and create events.

xattr -d com.apple.quarantine ./src/calpp
cat <<EOF | osascript tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" set theWorkflow to "${alfred_workflow_bundleid}" set allowed to "allowed" set theValue to "1" set configuration allowed to value theValue in workflow theWorkflow reload workflow theWorkflow end tell EOF

ÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºø ÙÅå¥ ÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºøÔºø
Granting permission removes the "quarantined" flag that macOS automatically assigns to all files downloaded from the Internet.
Removing the flag prevents the system from classifying the program as corrupted and allows it to run.
Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£ ÙÅå¥ Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£Ôø£
To use the Calendar++ workflow, you have to allow it to run.

![Calendar++ Icon](icon.png)
# Calendar++
A feature-rich block calendar workflow with Apple Calendar integration to __view__, __create__, and __search__ calendar events, or to check your upcoming __agenda__.
--- Created by [Patrick Sy](https://github.com/zeitlings) | [Github](https://github.com/zeitlings/alfred-calendar) | [Alfred Forum](https://www.alfredforum.com/topic/19699-calendar/) | [Buy me a Coffee](https://ko-fi.com/zeitlings) ‚òï ---
## Setup
1. Install the [SF Pro font](https://developer.apple.com/fonts/) from Apple to see the icons 2. Ensure Alfred has [permission](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/getting-started/permissions/) to access calendar events¬π
## Usage
View the calendar via the `cc` keyword or by using the [Hotkey](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/). Quick access keywords for the __agenda__, creating __new events__, and the global __search__ are derived from the keyword by appending __a__, __n__, or __s__: `cca`, `ccn`, `ccs`.
### Block Calendar
![](images/previews/1-block-calendar.png) 1. __Type__ + the name of a month or year to jump to that month or year¬≤ + `<` or `>` to step through the months + `!` to see available *!bang* expansions + `?` to see the internal configuration 2. __Week Row__ + <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open a selected week in the Calendar app if no events are found + <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open the __week view__ listing available events of a selected week + <kbd>‚åò</kbd> to view the number of events scheduled for a selected week + <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open a selected week in the Calendar app
### Week View
![](images/previews/2-week-view.png) 1. __Type__ to filter events based on your query + filter by event information, e.g. a location + filter by weekday names, e.g. Monday 2. __On Weekdays__ + <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open the selected weekday in the Calendar app 3. __On Calendar Events__ + <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open the selected event in the Calendar app + <kbd>‚åÉ</kbd> to view the exact time of the event or the timeline representation + <kbd>‚áß</kbd> to preview a location on Apple Maps or a URL associated with the event + <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open a location in Google Maps or join a video call + <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to create a new event after the selected event + <kbd>fn</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open a URL associated with the selected event + <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>L</kbd> to view the digest of a calendar event's info as [large type](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/large-type)
### Agenda
Quick access keyword: `cca` ![](images/previews/3-agenda-view.png) 1. __Type__ to filter upcoming events based on your query 2. __On Calendar Events__ + <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open the selected event in the Calendar app + <kbd>‚åÉ</kbd> to view the exact time of the event + <kbd>‚áß</kbd> to preview a location on Apple Maps or a URL associated with the event + <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open a location in Google Maps or join a video call + <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to create a new event after the selected event + <kbd>fn</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open a URL associated with the selected event + <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>L</kbd> to view the digest of a calendar event's info as [large type](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/large-type)
### New Event
Quick access keyword: `ccn`
![](images/previews/4-new-event.png) 1. __Type__ to specify the new event. + `<` or `>` to modify the day + `+` or `-` to modify the time¬≥ + `(note)` to add a note + `(@location)` to add a location + `(=calendar)` to specify a calendar + `(!title)` to ensure that some text is registered only as title + `!allday` to create an all day event + `https://example.com` to add a URL to the event 2. <kbd>‚å•</kbd> to view the cheat sheet 3. <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>L</kbd> to view the info of the new calendar event as [large type](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/large-type)
> üí° Date information is automatically parsed from natural language
### Search Mask
Quick access keyword: `ccs`
![](images/previews/5-search-mask.png) __Type__ to find events based on your query. > üí° The target time frame is one year: Half a year in the past, half a year in the future.
## Symbol Key
- `ÙÄâ£` The event has a URL or the note contains URLs - `ÙÄâÜ` The event has a note - `ÙÄâ´` The event has attendees - `ÙÄé´` The event has a location - `ÙÄØõ` The event is a recurring event - `ÙÄçâ` An online meeting is associated with the event
---
## Footnotes ¬π If that's not enough, try dragging the executable into the list of apps with access (see [#2](https://github.com/zeitlings/alfred-calendar/issues/2#issuecomment-2132736512)). ¬≤ For example, `cc jan 2025 <<<` reveals the block calendar for October 2024. ¬≥ Only `+` and `-` symbols at the very beginning or end will be considered to ensure their normal use everywhere else.
Check to emphasize the days that have events.
‚ùô Spacing ¬∑ Influences the gap between the days.
‚ùô Padding ¬∑ Influences the distance to the LHS window border.
Graphically display the relative position of events within the day.
Set an alert for new events
‚ùô Alert ¬∑ Default time to be alerted before the event in hours.
‚ùô Duration ¬∑ Default duration of new calendar events in hours.
Show events of subscribed calendars or birthdays.
Check to include Quick-Look previews for calendar events (‚áß). Negatively impacts performance.
Comma-separated list of names of calendars that should be ignored.
Set a language tag to override the calendars current locale.
